sub_topic: Calculating the density of inorganic compounds
message_1: Calculate the density of barium sulfate ($\text{BaSO}_{4}$) with a molecular weight of 233.39 g/mol, assuming a sample with a mass of 5 g occupies a volume of 3 mL.
message_2:
To calculate the density of barium sulfate, we can use the formula:

Density = Mass / Volume

We are given the mass (5 g) and volume (3 mL) of the sample. 

Density = (5 g) / (3 mL)

Density = 1.67 g/mL

Therefore, the density of the barium sulfate sample is 1.67 g/mL.
